intro: Licania crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Licania crassifolia is typically found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests.
